cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi SSW of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest, cross central-western Cuba Monday, enter the Florida Straits, then track near the west coast of Florida toward the Big Bend and eventually into the Atlantic off GA/SC mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida near the Tampa Bay / Big Bend region

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for the Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas (no watch yet for southeast Florida)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for Florida at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, especially the west coast, Keys, and adjacent Gulf waters; Atlantic southeast Florida within the broader cone
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (isolated 6 inch amounts forecast for parts of the Florida Peninsula)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (Atlantic side surge forecast less than 2 ft)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (≥39 mph) possible Monday night through Tuesday with peak probability ~18%
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation up to 1-2 ft possible along exposed Atlantic beaches; negligible in sheltered harbor
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with locally higher totals early next week, causing brief flash or urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Atlantic beaches; occasional squall lines may briefly reduce visibility and halt cargo operations
